attributes.action: Parliament must debate any decision on military action in Syria.
attributes.background: The risk of ill considered military action in Syria leading to escalating confrontation and global conflict is too great for it to be taken without proper Parliamentary debate.

rejection.details:
There was an emergency debate on the current situation in Syria and the UK Government’s approach on Monday 16 April.

You can read a transcript of the debate here: https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2018-04-16/debates/833CC42E-A6EE-4070-8B0E-51468B6AEFD7/Syria

You can watch the debate here: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Event/Index/618c6ebe-5584-4d5e-bae5-62348bcf96c4

There was a debate on 17 April on Parliament's rights in relation to the approval of military action by British Forces overseas. You can find out more here:

https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2018/april/emergency-debate-parliamentary-approval-of-military-action-overseas/

If you would like the Government to ask Parliament to vote on military action in Syria, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/217264
